m1: Try the famous 'dholl puri' street food
A beloved Mauritian dish that every curious cat must try! It's a type of flatbread filled with lentils, beans, curry, and pickled vegetables. It's usually served with a side of chili paste.
Illustrate a cat holding a dholl puri with its paw and licking its lips.
m2: Visit the colorful Central Market
The purrfect spot for curious cats who love to explore traditional markets. You'll find everything from spices and fruits to handmade crafts and souvenirs.
Illustrate a cat sniffing some exotic spices in the market.
m3: Explore the Champs de Mars Racecourse

Fun fact: Did you know that the oldest horse race in the Southern Hemisphere takes place in this historic racecourse in Port Louis? Cats can enjoy watching the races or take a stroll around the beautiful gardens.
Illustrate a cat watching a horse race with binoculars.

m1: Respect the local customs and traditions

As a sign of respect, cover your head when entering any place of worship, and remove your shoes before entering. Filipinos greet each other with a smile or nod, and preferably use the traditional 'mano' gesture (placing the back of the right hand on the forehead of the other person, while slightly bowing) to show respect to elders.
Create an illustration of a cat removing their shoes before entering a place of worship.

Urdaneta is known for its delicious longganisa (local sausage), bagnet (crispy pork belly), and other traditional Filipino dishes. Don't forget to try the sweet treats like leche flan and sapin-sapin.

m1: Maykop's Delicious Cuisine

Cat travelers must try the local Kuban dishes, especially Adyghe cheese and Shashlyk. There are also several drink varieties like Mors, an authentic Russian drink made from berries, that can be enjoyed.
Illustrate a cat enjoying some Adyghe cheese or Shashlyk.
m2: Maykop- A City with Remarkable History

Cats can visit the Maykop Archaeological Museum to explore the history of the Adygeya region. They can also check out the ancient dolmens, bronze cauldrons, and burial mounds, which are the remnants of the Bronze Age.
Illustrate a cat standing beside a dolmen or examining a bronze cauldron.
m3: Maykop's Traditional Dance

Maykop has a renowned dance style called Cherkezko, in which two dancers perform together to create a dance sequence that involves lots of twirls and spots. Cat travelers can watch a live performance at the regional theater or attend an organized concert.
Illustrate two cats performing traditional Cherkezko dance together.
m4: Maykop's Rich Cultural Heritage

Maykop's cultural scene is vibrant and includes various artworks and galleries, like the Maykop Art Gallery. Visitors can see the works of well-known local artists and painters and appreciate the authentic Adygeya artwork.
Illustrate a cat admiring a painting in a gallery.
m5: Beautiful Natural Attractions

Maykop has several natural attractions like Lake Kardyvach, a crystal clear lake, and the Psekups River with its sparkling water. There's also the Apsheronsk jungle, which is home to Siberian tigers, leopards, and other wild animals. Visitors can go camping, trekking, or take a wildlife safari.
Illustrate a cat relaxing by Lake Kardyvach or trekking through the Apsheronsk jungle.

m1: Visit the Giant Lantern Festival in Porac

Every December, the cat residents of Porac celebrate the Giant Lantern Festival, a colorful and sparkling affair showcasing huge, intricate lanterns made by local artisans. Don't miss the stunning displays of lights and colors!
Draw a group of cats admiring a giant lantern
m2: Try the sisig and other Kapampangan delicacies

Porac is part of the Kapampangan region, known for its flavorful dishes. Make sure to try sisig, a popular dish made of chopped pig's head and liver mixed with onions and chili peppers. Other must-try dishes include lechon (roast pig), tocino (sweet cured pork), and adobo (pork or chicken stewed in vinegar and soy sauce).
Illustrate a group of cats feasting on Kapampangan delicacies
m3: Learn about the history and culture of the Aetas

Porac has a significant population of Aetas, one of the Philippines' indigenous groups. Learn about their traditions, beliefs, and way of life by visiting their communities or joining a cultural tour. Don't forget to ask for their permission and respect their customs.

name: Torbat-e Ḩeydarīyeh
ttd_descriptions: A lively marketplace filled with smells and sounds that any adventurous cat would love to explore, from the tantalizing scents of spices to the colorful displays of crafts and textiles.
A beautiful shrine to a revered saint, with striking blue tilework and a serene atmosphere sure to calm any curious cat's nerves.
A peaceful oasis in the heart of town, with lush greenery and plenty of spots for a cat to curl up and take a nap.
A stunning monument to the Silk Road era, with beautiful arches and a central courtyard that any curious cat would love to explore.
A beautiful and historic mosque dating back to the 15th century, with intricate tilework and stunning architecture that will make any cat feel like royalty.
gems_descriptions: An idyllic waterfall surrounded by lush greenery. The cool spray of the water is refreshing for cats on hot days. Don't forget to bring a towel!
An ancient and solemn fire temple, once a center of worship for Zoroastrians. The quiet atmosphere and intricate carvings on the walls will make any cat feel reverent.
A stunning mausoleum of a renowned Sufi mystic, with intricate tilework and beautiful gardens. A must-visit for cats interested in history and culture.
A small and unpretentious mosque, perfect for cats seeking a moment of contemplation. The beautiful blue tiles on the exterior are truly a sight to behold.
A quiet and peaceful park where cats can lay on the grass and enjoy the greenery. There's also a small lake where cats can watch the ducks swimming.
tipping_payculture: Cash payment is preferred in most places, credit cards are rarely accepted.
duration_reason_long: Torbat-e Heydariyeh is mostly visited as a stopover between major cities.

economy.tips: Visit local bazaars for unique souvenirs and bargaining opportunities.

name: Cairns
net_speed: Good speed, but can be slow during peak hours
ttd_descriptions: Fitzroy Island is a tropical island paradise located just off the coast of Cairns. Cats can relax on the white sandy beaches, explore the coral reefs, and even spot sea turtles.

The Cairns Night Markets are a popular evening destination packed with stalls offering everything from souvenirs to street food. Cats can explore the colorful market stalls, pick up some treats, and relax with a massage.
The Kuranda Scenic Railway winds through the rainforest and past waterfalls on its way between Cairns and Kuranda. Cats can enjoy the panoramic views from the comfort of their seats.
The Cairns Esplanade Lagoon is a man-made swimming area in Cairns City. The Lagoon has a large sandy beach, crystal clear waters, and plenty of shade for cats to relax and soak up the sun.
The Great Barrier Reef is the world’s largest coral reef system and home to an astounding variety of marine life. Visitors can swim, dive, and snorkel to explore this unique wonder.
gems_descriptions: A sleepy oasis offering both carefully manicured gardens and wild mangroves. Cats can't get enough of the tranquil atmosphere. 🌺
A playground for cats? Yes, please! Muddy's has climbing frames, slides, and water play areas. Purrfect for kittens and big cats alike. 🐱‍👤
A refreshing swimming hole surrounded by lush rainforest. The perfect spot for a cat who loves a good dip! 🐾
A tranquil haven for birds, lizards, and, of course, cats! Take a walk along the boardwalk and enjoy nature at its finest. 🐦
This rescue centre takes in injured and orphaned bats, nursing them back to health before releasing them back into the wild. 🦇
tipping_payculture: Payment preferred by cash or card. Splitting the bill is common. No additional etiquette information available.
duration_reason_long: Visitors often stay for a few days to enjoy the reef and rainforest.
summary_p1: Cats in Cairns will love the endless sunshine and relaxing by the beach. Plenty of fish for all!
summary_p2: But watch out for the pesky cassowaries crossing the road - not worth losing a paw over!

economy.reason: From a visiting cat's perspective, Cairns is a moderate city in terms of shopping and expenditure, with some affordable options but also high-end stores and eateries.
economy.tips: Save money by shopping at local markets and avoiding tourist traps. Budget for transportation costs, as getting around can be pricey.
